section.p: Users want to communicate with apps in a human-like way and receive personalized assistance. This interaction paradigm is called “conversational UI”. It is a key part of SAP's product strategy and a key UA strategy topic.

Chatbots help users perform their tasks more quickly and in a natural way. They respond to user questions or commands. The user experience is about engaging in a fluid, human-like dialog with the user (voice recognition and/or text).
The SAP Help Portal is a goldmine for chatbots, with structured content helping SAP make its chatbots smarter and more personalized.

Colleagues in UA are language and communication specialists who understand the context of users, their intents and expectations, and how they use language. With the right infrastructure, technology, and enablement, they can ensure that SAP chatbots converse naturally and easily with users and create a frictionless conversational experience.

Project Socrates started in April 2018, with wave 1 running until January 2019 and wave 2 running till end 2019. The purpose of Project Socrates is to enable the SAP UA and translation organizations to become the go-to experts for conversational design of SAP chatbots in the intelligent enterprise.
The Project Socrates team ensures UA and Translation have the right infrastructure, technology, content, guidelines, and training to support SAP’s vision of an intelligent enterprise.

The project is staffed with UA, Translation, Development, and UX colleagues from across SAP products and locations. The project is divided into separate work packages, a cross-work package group for multilingual aspects, and a group of consulting advisers from various areas within SAP. For more details on Project Socrates, see: Get Project News on Chatbots@UA Jam Group https://jam4.sapjam.com/groups/HVprp1Pkb1GPUw7E4c4TXi/overview_page/iCfuEYZ1hYZdTG7SgieCgT.
